page.title: 15A Local View of Harlescott.
page.content: Windermere Road was the site of a large Air Force Camp during the Second World War. Mount Pleasant Road was just a narrow side road, no houses, there was a wooden bridge sited here. Beyond the railway bridge on the left hand side was a row of three story terraced houses known as Mount Pleasant, these houses are still there today in 1985. Opposite these on the right hand side was acottage where an old lady sold vegetables and fruit by the garden wall she has a summer house with stained glass windows and a parrot who could talk to the passers by. Near the 'Steam Wagon' public house was a large farm known as Randall's Farm, to reach the Ellesmere road you had to go via a narrow lane.
